abstract: Karen Crouse On Golf column remarks on appearance by world No 1 golfer Jordan Spieth at Kids Day event; notes that brevity of interview and fact that young players had little chance to ask questions or get autographs, illustrates problem previously articulated by Spieth--that increased fame brings more demands on his time.
lead_paragraph: Spieth spoke to a group of young golfers in New Jersey about the lessons he had learned on the way to becoming the world’s top-ranked player at 22 years old.

headline.main: Jordan Spieth Reassesses a Career Path From the Top, Where Time Is Short
headline.print_headline: Reassessing a Path From the Top, Where Time Is Short

snippet: Spieth spoke to a group of young golfers in New Jersey about the lessons he had learned on the way to becoming the world’s top-ranked player at 22 years old.
